text: Cho Yang-ho (; 8 March 1949 â€“ 7 April 2019), also known as Y. H. Cho, was a South Korean businessman. He was the chairman and chief executive officer (CEO) of Korean Air, South Korea's flag carrier and largest airline. He served as chairman of the Hanjin Group. He was also a founding member of the SkyTeam airline alliance. He was born in Incheon, Gyeonggi. Cho died on 7 April 2019 after an illness in Los Angeles, California, United States. He was 70. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Disease- related deaths in Los Angeles Category:People from Incheon Category:South Korean businesspeople
title: Cho Yang-ho
